body:
Hello @LambertWM, thank you for your interest in our work! Please visit our [Custom Training Tutorial](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Train-Custom-Data) to get started, and see our [Google Colab Notebook](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb), [Docker Image](https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3), and [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) for example environments. 
  
If this is a bug report, please provide screenshots and **minimum viable code to reproduce your issue**, otherwise we can not help you.

@LambertWM yes this is just CUDA OOM. You can reduce batch size or img-size. Apex will train at mixed precision if installed as well. We verified windows functionality a while back but have introduced many changes since, so there may be bugs. We currently run daily on macos and linux. Could you submit a PR with your windows changes?

`python3 train.py --batch 8 --img 320`

Hello, I also encountered this problem when using this framework, which has not been solved at present.
My computer configuration :
RTX 2070 8g x2
win10 
cuda 10.2
pytorch 1.5
After my close debugging, I found that the problem appeared in **trian.py**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/64250862/80189311-0ef4a180-8645-11ea-8e1c-f05d5d7bf830.png)
**loss.backward**go wrong
If there is a solution, please tell me, thank you very much.

@KAL-AL you may have environment issues. We also don’t validate much on windows, I would recommend a Linux system for best results. I’ll link you to a few working environments here. If you can’t avoid windows suggest run our docker image.

## Reproduce Our Environment

To access an up-to-date working environment (with all dependencies including CUDA/CUDNN, Python and PyTorch preinstalled), consider a:

- **GCP** Deep Learning VM with $300 free credit offer: [GCP Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/GCP-Quickstart) 
- **Google Colab Notebook** with 12 hours of free GPU time: [Google Colab Notebook](https://colab.sandbox.google.com/github/ultralytics/yolov3/blob/master/tutorial.ipynb)
- **Docker Image** from https://hub.docker.com/r/ultralytics/yolov3. See [Docker Quickstart Guide](https://github.com/ultralytics/yolov3/wiki/Docker-Quickstart)

@glenn-jocher @KAL-AL 
just a quick note to confirm that my problem was an "environment" issue, not an 'out of memory' issue. Below are my notes from this weekend on how to create a windows-based environment that works.

Here is the (last part of the) output from `pip list` from the environment that _did not work_
> tensorboard            2.2.1      
tensorboard-plugin-wit 1.6.0.post3
tensorboardX           2.0        
torch                  1.5.0+cu92 
torchutils             0.0.4      
torchvision            0.6.0+cu92 
tqdm                   4.45.0     
urllib3                1.25.9     
Werkzeug               1.0.1      
wheel                  0.34.2     

I decided to create a new virtual environment and rebuild it from scratch. Here is the (last part of the) output from `pip list` from that new environment that _does work_
>tensorboard            2.2.1      
tensorboard-plugin-wit 1.6.0.post3
tensorboardX           2.0        
torch                  1.5.0      
torchvision            0.6.0      
tqdm                   4.45.0     
urllib3                1.25.9     
Werkzeug               1.0.1      
wheel                  0.34.2     

**Reproduce Windows Environment**
These are my notes from reproducing the environment that did work. I hope these are accurate enough to work on somebody else's machine ;)

_start by creating a virtual env, I called it ED_
`python -m venv ED`

_activate ED_
`ED\Scripts\activate.bat`

_see what we have as a starting point_
`pip list`
>Package           Version
astroid           2.3.3
colorama          0.4.3
isort             4.3.21
lazy-object-proxy 1.4.3
mccabe            0.6.1
pip               19.2.3
pylint            2.4.4
setuptools        41.2.0
six               1.14.0
wrapt             1.11.2
WARNING: You are using pip version 19.2.3, however version 20.0.2 is available.
You should consider upgrading via the 'python -m pip install --upgrade pip' command.

_upgrade pip, because .. why not?_
`python -m pip install --upgrade pip`

_this was taken from the tutorial for another PyTorch based neural network_
_see:_ https://github.com/zylo117/Yet-Another-EfficientDet-Pytorch 
`pip install numpy opencv-python tqdm tensorboard tensorboardX pyyaml`

_install PyTorch_
_see:_ https://pytorch.org/get-started/locally/ 
`pip install torch===1.5.0 torchvision===0.6.0 -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html`

_see what we have so far_
`pip list`
>absl-py                0.9.0
cachetools             4.1.0
certifi                2020.4.5.1
chardet                3.0.4
future                 0.18.2
google-auth            1.14.1
google-auth-oauthlib   0.4.1
grpcio                 1.28.1
idna                   2.9
Markdown               3.2.1
numpy                  1.18.3
oauthlib               3.1.0
opencv-python          4.2.0.34
Pillow                 7.1.2
pip                    20.0.2
protobuf               3.11.3
pyasn1                 0.4.8
pyasn1-modules         0.2.8
PyYAML                 5.3.1
requests               2.23.0
requests-oauthlib      1.3.0
rsa                    4.0
setuptools             41.2.0
six                    1.14.0
tensorboard            2.2.1
tensorboard-plugin-wit 1.6.0.post3
tensorboardX           2.0
torch                  1.5.0
torchvision            0.6.0
tqdm                   4.45.0
urllib3                1.25.9
Werkzeug               1.0.1
wheel                  0.34.2

_NOTE: the following might be inaccurate, as there was a bit of a struggle to install pycocoutils_

`pip install cython`

_install this very specific version of pycocoutils / cocoapi_
_see:_ https://github.com/philferriere/cocoapi#subdirectory=PythonAPI 
`pip install git+https://github.com/philferriere/cocoapi.git#subdirectory=PythonAPI`

`pip install matplotlib`

`pip list`
>absl-py                0.9.0      
cachetools             4.1.0      
certifi                2020.4.5.1 
chardet                3.0.4      
cycler                 0.10.0     
Cython                 0.29.17    
future                 0.18.2

kiwisolver             1.2.0

Enjoy !

@LambertWM thanks for the feedback! Occasionally we try to verify windows functionality but it's a struggle with limited resources, so its possible the repo drifts out of windows compatibility. Is there any specific code that might need to be changed, i.e. path building or anything else triggering errors out of the box on windows, now that you have a working environment?

EDIT: If you find any with simple fixes, please feel free to submit PRs. Thank you!

@glenn-jocher @LambertWM Thank you very much for the solution .Now the function has been realized in windows ，
My environment is Pytorch 1.5 + CUDA 10.1 + cudnn7.4.1.5.
I think the reason for the problem is that pytroch version is compatible with CUDA。
At first, my CUDA was 10.2。
There is a new problem now, but it does not affect the generation of files

File ".\train.py", line 428, in
train() # train normally
File ".\train.py", line 385, in train
dist.destroy_process_group() if torch.cuda.device_count() > 1 else None
AttributeError: module 'torch.distributed' has no attribute 'destroy_process_group'

@glenn-jocher 
Sorry to bother you. I got the same question "cuda out of memories".
I did not change anything in the code, just cloned your repo. 

(yolov3_pytorch) duyao@duyao-desktop:~/PycharmProjects/yolov3$ python train.py
Apex recommended for faster mixed precision training: https://github.com/NVIDIA/apex
Namespace(adam=False, batch_size=16, bucket='', cache_images=False, cfg='cfg/yolov3-spp.cfg', data='data/coco2017.data', device='', epochs=300, evolve=False, img_size=[320, 640], multi_scale=False, name='', nosave=False, notest=False, rect=False, resume=False, single_cls=False, weights='weights/yolov3-spp-ultralytics.pt')
Using CUDA device0 _CudaDeviceProperties(name='GeForce RTX 2080 Ti', total_memory=11016MB)

Start Tensorboard with "tensorboard --logdir=runs", view at http://localhost:6006/
Model Summary: 225 layers, 6.29987e+07 parameters, 6.29987e+07 gradients
Optimizer groups: 76 .bias, 76 Conv2d.weight, 73 other
Caching labels (117266 found, 1021 missing, 0 empty, 0 duplicate, for 118287 ima
Caching labels (4952 found, 48 missing, 0 empty, 0 duplicate, for 5000 images): 100%|████| 5000/5000 [00:00<00:00, 11389.17it/s]
Image sizes 320 - 640 train, 640 test
Using 8 dataloader workers
Starting training for 300 epochs...

     Epoch   gpu_mem      GIoU       obj       cls     total   targets  img_size
     0/299     6.57G      1.99       1.7     0.474      4.17       150       512:   0%|      | 1/7393 [00:03<7:25:10,  3.61s/it]
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train.py", line 412, in <module>
    train(hyp)  # train normally
  File "train.py", line 264, in train
    pred = model(imgs)
  File "/home/duyao/anaconda3/envs/yolov3_pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 550, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/duyao/PycharmProjects/yolov3/models.py", line 238, in forward
    return self.forward_once(x)
  File "/home/duyao/PycharmProjects/yolov3/models.py", line 292, in forward_once
    x = module(x)
  File "/home/duyao/anaconda3/envs/yolov3_pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 550, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/duyao/anaconda3/envs/yolov3_pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/container.py", line 100, in forward
    input = module(input)
  File "/home/duyao/anaconda3/envs/yolov3_pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 550, in __call__
    result = self.forward(*input, **kwargs)
  File "/home/duyao/anaconda3/envs/yolov3_pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/conv.py", line 349, in forward
    return self._conv_forward(input, self.weight)
  File "/home/duyao/anaconda3/envs/yolov3_pytorch/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/conv.py", line 346, in _conv_forward
    self.padding, self.dilation, self.groups)
RuntimeError: CUDA out of memory. Tried to allocate 64.00 MiB (GPU 0; 10.76 GiB total capacity; 9.55 GiB already allocated; 63.75 MiB free; 9.59 GiB reserved in total by PyTorch)
(yolov3_pytorch) duyao@duyao-desktop:~/PycharmProjects/yolov3$ 


My display card is a new 2080Ti card, and my cpu is i7 8700. I am very confused why this error will happen? Could you please give me some advice?
